io.github.zachohara.pictographer.core

Class Polynomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.zachohara.pictographer.core.Polynomial

  • public class Polynomial
extends java.lang.Object
    A Polynomial object represents a mathematical polynomial function. It can be easily queried for values that exist on the x-y plane and are on this function.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  Polynomial.Term
      A Term object represents a single term of a polynomial function.

    • Field Summary

      The list of terms that compose this polynomial.

      Polynomial()
      Constructs a new polynomial with no terms.

    • Method Detail

      • addTerm

        public Polynomial addTerm(double coefficient,
                          double power)
        Adds a new term with the given coefficient and power to this polynomial.
        Parameters:
        coefficient - the coefficient of x in the new term.
        power - the power of x in the new term.
        Returns:
        this polynomial after adding the new term.

      • addTerm

        public Polynomial addTerm(Polynomial.Term t)
        Adds a new Term object to this polynomial.
        Parameters:
        t - the Term to add to this polynomial.
        Returns:
        this polynomial after adding the new term.

      • valueAt

        public double valueAt(double x)
        Calculates the y-value of this polynomial function at the given x-coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to calculate a y-value for.
        Returns:
        the y-value at the given x-value.

      • getLatexString

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getLatexString()
        Deprecated. 
        Builds a string that contains the source code for representing this polynomial function in a LaTeX engine. This method assumes that every coefficient is a fraction with a numerator of 1, and that every exponent is an integer. If this is not true for this polynomial, the method will return an incorrect result. The method is deprecated for this reason.
        Returns:
        the LaTeX source for this polynomial function.

      • derivative

        public Polynomial derivative()
        Calculates the derivative of this polynomial and returns it as another Polynomial object.
        Returns:
        the Polynomial of this polynomial's derivative.
